meanings.definition: A series of short, sharp sounds
meanings.sent1: The rattlings of the keys jingled in his pocket.
meanings.sent2: I heard the rattlings of the dishes as they were being washed.
meanings.sent3: The rattlings of the wind chimes outside made a cheerful melody.
meanings.sent4: The rattlings of the typewriter filled the room with a rhythmic beat.
meanings.sent5: The rattlings of the coins in the jar were music to his ears.

meanings.definition: The act of shaking or vibrating with a rapid succession of small movements
meanings.sent1: The rattlings of the train made her feel dizzy.
meanings.sent2: The rattlings of the earthquake were felt throughout the city.
meanings.sent3: The rattlings of the car on the bumpy road made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rattlings of the tambourine added energy to the music.
meanings.sent5: The rattlings of the maracas created a festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A collection of small, loose items or debris
meanings.sent1: The attic was filled with the rattlings of forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent2: The beach was covered in the rattlings of seashells and pebbles.
meanings.sent3: The rattlings of papers on his desk made it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent4: The rattlings of leaves in the wind created a soothing rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The rattlings of toys on the floor signaled the presence of a child nearby.
